The behavior experienced is as follows:
- create a new Java Application launch configuration, enter some values click close
The next time I open the Run... menu the Java Application group is folded. If I click on the plus to expand it no children show up. If I create a new launch configuration I get an error saying that a launch configuration with the same name already exists.

I don't know if the exception still exists in newer versions. I just search Bugzilla for "LaunchConfigurationTabGroupViewer.java:1174" and didn't get any result so I thought it might be worthwhile to report it.

Is the location you are trying to make the new configuration in read-only?

The line of code throwing the error is because of a null working copy, which is odd, because the LCD only shows working copies....

The LC are created not shared so they will be created in the workspace. The workspace is not read only. It's on a Windows drive created through subst. But that worked fine for years so I don't think that could be the problem.
*** Bug 80049 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

I am thinking this is as simple as not providing a null check. In performApply
we were asking for a handle to the current working copy using getWorkingCopy()
which is spec'd to return null (but we were no checking for null).

There are instances when the working copy might be null, as perform apply is
called when tabs change, when they created/disposed, etc, outside of the user
actually pressing 'Apply'.

Gunnar, can you try a newer build to see if you can reproduce this error again
(we have added in a null check in 3.3)?
Is the null check available in 3.3 M5?
yes, it has been in the build since 12/7/2006
Gunnar, have you had a chance to try a later build?
Yes, sorry. I lost trac of this one. I wasn't able to reproduce this on 3.3 M5eh. (Europa M5).
